channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Limb Difference Awareness Month
item.description:
Monday, April 15, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Orange to support Limb Difference Awareness Month.

Aussie Hands provides support, information and encouragement to people born with a hand difference and their families. Each April is designated Limb Difference Awareness Month and celebrated around the world as a time to recognize those living with limb loss and limb difference.

This Light Up is organised by: The Aussie Hands Foundation Incorporated

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: World Voice Day
item.description:
Tuesday, April 16, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support World Voice Day.

World Voice Day is traditionally celebrated on 16 April and was founded in Brazil back in 1999 with the aim of drawing attention to the science and phenomenon of voice production. It soon grew to highlight the significant role that the voice plays in every aspect of our daily lives. World Voice Day has gained momentum across the globe, and currently over 50 countries join the annual celebration during the month of April. At no other time in our recent history has the human voice had such power to connect, reassure and support.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Dysphonia Network Inc

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support World Voice Day.

World Voice Day has gained momentum across the globe, and currently over 50 countries join the annual celebration during the month of April. At no other time in our recent history has the human voice had such power to connect, reassure and support.
This Light Up is organised by: Australian Dysphonia Network Inc
item.x-trumba:customfield: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: World Haemophilia Day
item.description:
Wednesday, April 17, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Red to support World Haemophilia Day.

World Haemophilia Day is the 17th of April and raises awareness about bleeding disorders and the need to build a family of support for those living with this disorder. Families come in many forms, but they all share the ability to support and advocate.

The Haemophilia Foundation Queensland (HFQ) provides representation, health promotion, education and support for people in Queensland affected by inherited bleeding disorders.

This Light Up is organised by: Haemophilia Foundation Queensland Inc.

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.xCal:description:
The Story Bridge will be lit Red to support World Haemophilia Day.

This Light Up is organised by: Haemophilia Foundation Queensland Inc.

The Pakistan Day Celebrations is being held in King George Square.

This Light Up is organised by: Pakistan Australian Cultural Association

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City

item.title: Run Army
item.description:
Saturday, April 20, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Red, Blue, Yellow and Green to support Run Army.

Run Army’s mission is to promotes health, fitness and wellbeing through running support programs and a nation‐wide event; to fulfil our commitment to the wellbeing of our people and the community. We have now moved into a new era, joining forces with Queensland’s Police, Fire and Ambulance services to create one super‐sized community event. Our combined efforts will unite all those who serve the community in uniform as we collectively strive for health and wellbeing and care for our veterans and their families.

The event is open to anyone who can walk or run at least 5km and you can participate at the physical events in Brisbane and Townsville or the virtual event anywhere in Australia or the world! Why not come and join us?

This Light Up is organised by: NX Sports Community Foundation Limited

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.xCal:description:
The Story Bridge will be lit Red, Blue, Yellow and Green to support Run Army.

We have now moved into a new era, joining forces with Queensland’s Police, Fire and Ambulance services to create one super‐sized community event. Our combined efforts will unite all those who serve the community in uniform as we collectively strive for health and wellbeing and care for our veterans and their families.
The event is open to anyone who can walk or run at least 5km and you can participate at the physical events in Brisbane and Townsville or the virtual event anywhere in Australia or the world! Why not come and join us?
This Light Up is organised by: NX Sports Community Foundation Limited

item.title: Global Intergenerational Week
item.description:
Monday, April 22, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Pink to support Global Intergenerational Week.

Global Intergenerational Week is an annual celebration of bringing older and younger generations together across the world. The event helps to promote intergenerational practice and create awareness of the benefits to the older and younger generations, and society more broadly including improved social and emotional wellbeing, improved sense of purpose and belonging, and breaking down ageist stereotypes.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Institute for Intergenerational Practice Limited

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.xCal:description:
The Story Bridge will be lit Pink to support Global Intergenerational Week.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Institute for Intergenerational Practice Limited

item.title: Lead Up to Anzac Day
item.description:
Tuesday, April 23, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Red, White and Blue to recognise the Lead Up to Anzac Day.

As we prepare to remember the legacy of ANZAC, tonight we honour all members of the ADF who have returned from Overseas service and remember those who did not.

This Light Up is organised by: Returned Services League of Australia (Qld Branch) South Eastern District Limited

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

As we prepare to remember the legacy of ANZAC, tonight we honour all members of the ADF who have returned from Overseas service and remember those who did not.
This Light Up is organised by: Returned Services League of Australia (Qld Branch) South Eastern District Limited
item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 2024 Anzac Day
item.description:
Thursday, April 25, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to commemorate 2024 Anzac Day.

As the sun rose on 25 April 1915, Australian and New Zealand soldiers rowed towards the shores of Gallipoli and into history. Every year since, Australians have gathered at Dawn Services or services of Remembrance, at parades, or in their driveways each year to remember their legacy and that of all who have followed in their footsteps.

The first ANZAC Day Parade took place in Brisbane on the 25 April 1916, and this year, the 108th ANZAC Day Parade is an opportunity to celebrate and recognise all those that have served and continue to serve our country.

The parade will be held on Adelaide Street, between George Street and Creek Street, from 9.45am to 12.30pm and will feature former and current ADF veterans and other groups that contribute to the Parade that make it the commemoration worthy of its heritage.

This Light Up is organised by: Returned Services League of Australia (Qld Branch) South Eastern District Limited

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

Friday, April 26, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Yellow, Blue and Red to support Brisbane Comedy Festival.

Brisbane Comedy Festival presented by Brisbane Powerhouse is an annual month-long event showcasing over 135 acts in over 300 events across four venues. Brisbane Comedy Festival is designed to bring a program of entertainment and attraction to Brisbane's event calendar.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Powerhouse

item.title: Autism Awareness Month and AEIOU Family Fun Day
item.description:
Saturday, April 27, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Blue to support Autism Awareness Month and AEIOU Family Fun Day.

April marks Autism Awareness Month and we are delighted to help raise awareness of AEIOU Foundation's work to support autistic children and their families. AEIOU once again is joining the global ‘Light it up Blue’ campaign, where organisations across the world light iconic structures, to bring our community together and reflect on the unique and shared experiences of families raising a child with autism. We recognise the challenges, which are real. And we celebrate the triumphs, for there are many.

AEIOU Foundation is a Brisbane‐based not‐for‐profit and charity organisation, leading the way in best‐practice early intervention for Australian children with autism. AEIOU's unique model integrates specialist therapy, early education and care in a long day care, play‐based environment, operating 9 specialist centres across Queensland.

This Light Up is organised by: AEIOU Foundation

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.description:
Sunday, April 28, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Yellow, Blue and Red to support Brisbane Comedy Festival.

Brisbane Comedy Festival presented by Brisbane Powerhouse is an annual month-long event showcasing over 135 acts in over 300 events across four venues. Brisbane Comedy Festival is designed to bring a program of entertainment and attraction to Brisbane's event calendar.

item.title: World Wish Day
item.description:
Monday, April 29, 2024

City Hall will be lit Blue to support World Wish Day.

Make-A-Wish Australia will be celebrating World Wish Day, a day that marks the first ever wish granted by Make-A-Wish US in 1980. In Australia we celebrate the day with ‘Wear It Blue To Make Wishes Come True’ – where we encourage all Australians to wear blue to show their support for wishes and all of the inspirational people who help make them come true.

This Light Up is organised by: Make-A-Wish Australia

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
City Hall will be lit Blue to support World Wish Day.

In Australia we celebrate the day with ‘Wear It Blue To Make Wishes Come True’ – where we encourage all Australians to wear blue to show their support for wishes and all of the inspirational people who help make them come true.

This Light Up is organised by: Make-A-Wish Australia
item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of Lyme Disease Awareness Day
item.description:
Tuesday, April 30, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green to support Eve of Lyme Disease Awareness Day.

May 1 is Lyme Disease Awareness Day. May is also Lyme Disease Awareness Month. Lyme Disease is a bacterial infection caused by a spiral shaped bacterium, Borrelia burgdorferi. It is commonly contracted by a tick bite, though other methods and vectors of transmission are possible. The Lyme Disease Association of Australia runs a campaign throughout May to raise awareness and support patients of Lyme and other tick-borne diseases.

The Lyme Disease Association of Australia is a small yet powerful registered charity and Australia’s peak patient body. We are committed to achieving universal recognition and equitable treatment for Australian Lyme and associated disease patients. We raise awareness of the potential dangers of tick bites, support patients 24/7, and liaise with parliamentarians to work for positive change regarding access to diagnosis, treatment and financial support.

This Light Up is organised by: Lyme Disease Assn of Australia Inc

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

It is commonly contracted by a tick bite, though other methods and vectors of transmission are possible. The Lyme Disease Association of Australia runs a campaign throughout May to raise awareness and support patients of Lyme and other tick-borne diseases.
The Lyme Disease Association of Australia is a small yet powerful registered charity and Australia’s peak patient body. We are committed to achieving universal recognition and equitable treatment for Australian Lyme and associated disease patients. We raise awareness of the potential dangers of tick bites, support patients 24/7, and liaise with parliamentarians to work for positive change regarding access to diagnosis, treatment and financial support.
This Light Up is organised by: Lyme Disease Assn of Australia Inc

item.description:
Tuesday, April 30, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Green to support Eve of Lyme Disease Awareness Day.

May 1 is Lyme Disease Awareness Day. May is also Lyme Disease Awareness Month. Lyme Disease is a bacterial infection caused by a spiral shaped bacterium, Borrelia burgdorferi. It is commonly contracted by a tick bite, though other methods and vectors of transmission are possible. The Lyme Disease Association of Australia runs a campaign throughout May to raise awareness and support patients of Lyme and other tick-borne diseases.

The Lyme Disease Association of Australia is a small yet powerful registered charity and Australia’s peak patient body. We are committed to achieving universal recognition and equitable treatment for Australian Lyme and associated disease patients. We raise awareness of the potential dangers of tick bites, support patients 24/7, and liaise with parliamentarians to work for positive change regarding access to diagnosis, treatment and financial support.

This Light Up is organised by: Lyme Disease Assn of Australia Inc

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
